Happy Retirement Roger Zeeman!

Roger lived in Payson, Utah in his younger years. He worked at a family owned business doing upholstery most of his life. They also sold motorcycles and snowmobiles in their business and Roger was their mechanic. In 1980, he married Sheri Butler and in 1983 they moved to Delta to start their lives together. In 1985, he was hired by Millard School District to be a maintenance specialist performing various duties and was over the district’s asbestos program. We have appreciated Roger’s dedicated service in maintaining a safe working and learning environment for our students and employees. Roger and Sheri have four children and 4 grandchildren with 2 on the way. His hobbies include ATV riding, golfing, hunting, pinenut picking, and fishing.

Happy Retirement Kaye Stewart!

Kaye Stewart started at Fillmore Elementary 31 years ago, and eventually moved into the management position at FES. She is a valued employee and is loved and respected by students and colleagues. Kaye is cognizant of the National School Lunch Program requirements and stays up-to-date with best practices. She is always aware of the individual needs of the students in the building, and she goes out of her way to meet their needs. The kids know that Mrs. Stewart will take care of them and that they will not leave the lunchroom hungry. Additionally, Kaye runs a tight ship, and she manages the lunchroom in an organized and efficient manner through her leadership skills. Kaye has the lunchroom running smoothly and effectively. Menus are planned, equipment is clean, and reports are accurately completed. Fillmore Elementary will miss Kaye’s contagious laugh, passion for the holidays (especially Halloween), and her love for those students who are less fortunate. Kaye, thank you for your service!

Happy Retirement Emily Smith!

Emily Smith has worked for Millard School District 42.5 years as a custodian. She began in December 1977 and will retire this year. Ms. Smith worked at many schools including Delta South Elementary, Delta High School, and Delta North Elementary. She was the head custodian when the new high school was built, coordinating the transition from the old to the new. Working all those years provided the opportunity for Emily to make many friends. She tries to do her best and expects the same of others she works with. She is friendly and enjoys the students and staff in the schools. She will miss them.

Emily is a giving person, always willing to help anyone in need. She has a soft heart for animals and loves each of her pets. Some of her favorite things include camping, fishing, traveling, working in her yard, and her granddaughter, Laiklyn. She plans to do a lot of her favorite things during retirement.

Millard School District will miss Emily and appreciates all her years of service.

Happy Retirement Nathan Sanders!

Mr. Sanders graduated from BYU and came to Delta where he has taught for the past 32 years. He was influenced toward becoming a teacher largely as a result of his father being a career educator. He has taught several Social Studies classes as well as Spanish, Computer Tech, and Journalism for one year. Other responsibilities and teaching assignments he has had have included National Honor Society Advisor, assisting with Academic Decathlon, and some adult education. He has also been the computer and network specialist at the high school for many years. He notes that he will miss the associations with staff, friends, and colleagues that he has had over the years. At this point, future plans are not certain but they include continuing to work at other jobs, perhaps some travel, and spending time with family. He has 10 children and currently 5 grandchildren with two more on the way.

Happy Retirement Camille Rowley!

Mrs. Rowley has been in all the schools in Delta. She started out as an Instructional Assistant and Delta High School before moving to Delta Middle school for a year. After obtaining her Special Education degree, she moved to Delta South as a teacher. She has been teaching in the field for the last 28 years. After working at Delta South, she was part of the Delta Early Childhood Center and spent ½ days there and the other half day at Delta Elementary. She has finished out her teaching at the Delta South working primarily with Kindergarten and First Grade students. Mrs. Rowley is known for providing students with materials that match their skill while maintaining high expectations. She is soft-spoken and students are engaged in the instruction that she provides. She cares about the students and is a great partner to the classroom teacher. Her colleagues will miss her as she has great ideas on how to help each student. As she ends her career, she will be missed but we are sure she will be busy with all her quilting projects.

Happy Retirement Armando Ramos!

Armando started his career at DHS in January of 1987 and worked at both elementary schools; he will end his career where he started at Delta High. When asked which place was his favorite, he said he really enjoyed working at all the schools and has met some great people in Millard School District. Although he was somewhat nervous to make the change from elementary to high school, he said the students are very respectful and kind. Reuniting with old friends at the high school was fun even though some had retired. There were a few remaining from when he started 33 years ago. The greatest change was seeing Mr. Rob Fowles as the vice principal because he was a basketball player the last time Armando was at DHS. His retirement plans include going to Spain to see his 93-year old Dad, traveling with is beautiful wife, and spending time with his seven grand kids. He hopes to get to Alaska and do a little hunting and fishing.

Happy Retirement Holly Nissen!

Mrs. Nissen decided in First grade that she wanted to be a First Grade teacher just like the one that she had!! The other teacher was her mother. She was her mother’s aide while she was in High School and knew that this was the grade for her!! She taught a couple of years in Kansas and spent the rest of her career (35 years) in the Millard School District. Mrs. Nissen has always been a positive influence in her classroom as well as the school. She always has a smile on her face and says something nice about everyone and everything!! She is always willing to do what is asked of her – with a smile on her face! Her laugh and enthusiasm is contagious. Mrs. Nissen started at the old Delta South, went to Delta Elementary, and returned to the new Delta South! Though this was not the ending of her career that she expected, she has taken each day and tried to find a positive in what is happening in the world. She will enjoy her retirement time traveling, doing quilting projects, and visiting her family.

Happy Retirement Kirtt Myers!

Kirtt Myers has been a teacher at Delta Middle School for 31 years. During these years of service, he has influenced the life of several thousand students, parents’ and countless colleagues. Mr. Myers is an incredible math teacher. His ability to teach, his sense of humor, hard work, and love for students has made him a teacher that is loved by all.

Throughout the years, Mr. Myers has cared more about teaching students how to be great people than great mathematicians!!! He is a constant motivator, who has always believed in his students, and helped them believe in themselves. Mr. Myers will be most remembered for the following life lessons: People matter more than outcomes, life is 10% what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it, and laughter is always the best medicine!! Thank you Mr. Myers… Delta Middle School hasn’t been the same since you came, nor will it ever be the same when you leave. “Never die you good looking guy!!”. We love you!!!!

Happy Retirement Carol Meinhardt!

Mrs. Carol Meinhardt has been teaching our Business and Accounting programs at the Technical Center for the past 24 years. She has been a great example to all of us for her incredible work ethics, love and concern for the students, her passion for FBLA (Future Business Leaders of America), and her willingness to help anyone. Many of us have joked with her about making her residence at the Tech. She can be seen dedicating much of her free time at school after hours, throughout the evenings, and during many weekends. She has always kept her door open after school to provide extra assistance to any student that may be struggling in her class. She has prepared and helped many students qualify on a state and national level at the FBLA competitions. We all consider Mrs. Meinhardt as a dear friend and have enjoyed the opportunity to have her at our school! We cannot thank her enough and wish her the best in her retirement!!

Happy Retirement Diane George!

Mrs. George started her career in the old Delta North Elementary before she moved to Delta South Elementary. She really enjoyed her first two years at Delta North because she got to teach with her mother!! She taught two years of First grade before she became a Kindergarten Teacher. Mrs. George enjoyed her interactions with her fellow teachers, the staff throughout the years, and parents. She is always positive no matter the circumstance. She will be missed greatly for the wisdom and ideas that she shares constantly with her team.

Happy Retirement Rick Bishop!

For the past 28 years, Mr. Bishop has been behind the wheel teaching our children to drive and during those 28 years there was only one accident in the driver’s education car. Truly a miracle when you think about how some students have never been behind the wheel. Mr. Bishop has been instrumental in helping students find a love of sports through various activities he taught in PE. He not only taught team sports, he also introduced students to golf, tennis, badminton and other life-long sports. He says the best thing about being a teacher at DHS is watching the programs succeed regardless of what the activity is…sports, the arts, academics, or other activities. He believes that life is better at school when we have successes in all areas. Mr. Bishop plans to travel, farm, and follow DHS activities. He has 7 children and 12 grandchildren who will keep him busy.

Deb Allen will be greatly missed. Delta North cannot thank her enough for all she has done the last 16 years.

Personalized Learning Initiative Update

Millard School District’s Personalized Learning Initiative is off to a great start! We have 64 Chromebook labs in our schools with more on the way. These labs are being put to good use. Secondary teachers build their classes in Canvas to provide our students opportunities to learn anytime and anywhere. This also prepares our students for College as Canvas is the primary program used in Utah’s college campuses.

Elementary grades are using a wide range of tools to individualize learning for every student. Reading passages, math lessons, and writing prompts are being given out to meet the needs of each individual student in the class. The kids love to use technology!

It becomes more clear each day that technology will play a major role in the future of our students. We at Millard School District are committed to preparing our students for this future by providing them every opportunity possible to use and apply the available technologies and continue to adapt as necessary.

A Special Tribute to Daniel Anderson

In the April 14, 2016 board meeting, the Millard School District Board of Education gave special tribute to Daniel Anderson, as he had served on the board for a little over three years from January 1, 2013 up until his unexpected death on March 1, 2016. He was serving as the board president since March 12, 2015.

His family graciously attended board meeting to accept his awards, an engraven school bell and his presidential plaque, which were presented to them by Adam Britt, Board President. President Britt expressed his thanks and gratitude for the years of service that Daniel had given unto the patrons, staff, and students of the school district. He was a tremendous man and will be greatly missed.

post_text:
Wednesday, March 2, 2016

The Millard School District has lost one of its greatest friends and advocates in the passing of our School Board President, Mr. Daniel Anderson. Daniel has always put the best interest of our students at the center of every discussion and every decision. His sincere expressions of gratitude for our staff, our students, and our communities will be sorely missed. He has always been first to recognize excellence, first to appreciate efforts, and first to acknowledge concerns. Those who have been recipients of his warmth and kindness have been lifted and made better as we watched his example of caring for the needs of others. We are all better people for having known and associated with Daniel Anderson. His leadership and devotion will be missed by our schools and our communities. While we mourn for our loss, we turn our love and our sympathy to Daniel’s beloved wife Sherilyn, and the Anderson family. Please include them in your thoughts and prayers.
